_header: Though love be strong and mickle of might [Þey loue be strong and mikel of mith]

BLHar7322.Transcription: þey loue be stro[n]g & mikel of mithfor wele for wo trewloue mat lithTreuloue is large fre & hende& loue ȝif alleþing bleþeli to his frendein wele & wo loue stondit fastefor lif for det trewloue wil lastefer & freye loue hat on heufor trewloue is fress & euere neu
BLHar7322.Note:
Lines 3-4 formerly erroneously treated as separate Boffey  and  Edwards (2005)
XJulia Boffey,   and  A. S. G. Edwards.  
             A New Index of Middle English Verse.
         London: The British Library, 2005 6070; written as prose, inserted into Latin, with Latin text separating the four couplets.
BLHar7322.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 253; rev. ed. 262.
